Addr.description:
A human readable address.

In Cosmos, this is typically bech32 encoded. But for multi-chain smart contracts no assumptions should be made other than being UTF-8 encoded and of reasonable length.

This type represents a validated address. It can be created in the following ways 1. Use `Addr::unchecked(input)` 2. Use `let checked: Addr = deps.api.addr_validate(input)?` 3. Use `let checked: Addr = deps.api.addr_humanize(canonical_addr)?` 4. Deserialize from JSON. This must only be done from JSON that was validated before such as a contract's state. `Addr` must not be used in messages sent by the user because this would result in unvalidated instances.

This type is immutable. If you really need to mutate it (Really? Are you sure?), create a mutable copy using `let mut mutable = Addr::to_string()` and operate on that `String` instance.

contract.description: contract is the crate name of the implementing contract, eg. `crate:cw20-base` we will use other prefixes for other languages, and their standard global namespacing

version.description: version is any string that this implementation knows. It may be simple counter "1", "2". or semantic version on release tags "v0.7.0", or some custom feature flag list. the only code that needs to understand the version parsing is code that knows how to migrate from the given contract (and is tied to it's implementation somehow)

cargo_debug.description: Provides the cargo debug mode that was used for the build.

cargo_opt_level.description: Provides the opt value set by cargo during the build

commit_branch.description: Provides the name of the git branch that was used for the build, for example `master`.

commit_sha.description: Provides the hash of the commit that was used for the build, for example `46f83e112520533338245862d366f6a02cef07d4`.

commit_timestamp.description: Provides the timestamp of the commit that was used for the build, for example `2021-02-23T08:08:02-05:00`.

contract_name.description: Provides the name of the binary, i.e. the content of `CARGO_PKG_NAME` environmental variable.

rustc_version.description: Provides the rustc version that was used for the build, for example `1.52.0-nightly`.

last_rewarded.description: The id of the last node that has already received its rewards.

estimation.description: The reward estimation for the current epoch, i.e. the amount of tokens that could be claimable after the epoch finishes and the state of the network does not change.

current_stake_value.description: The current stake value given all past rewarding and compounding since the original staking was performed.

current_stake_value_detailed_amount.description: The current stake value. Note that it's nearly identical to `current_stake_value`, however, it contains few additional decimal points for more accurate reward calculation.

detailed_estimation_amount.description: The full reward estimation. Note that it's nearly identical to `estimation`, however, it contains few additional decimal points for more accurate reward calculation.

estimation.description: The reward estimation for the current epoch, i.e. the amount of tokens that could be claimable after the epoch finishes and the state of the network does not change.

original_stake.description: The amount of tokens initially staked.

Decimal.description:
A fixed-point decimal value with 18 fractional digits, i.e. Decimal(1_000_000_000_000_000_000) == 1.0

The greatest possible value that can be represented is 340282366920938463463.374607431768211455 (which is (2^128 - 1) / 10^18)

family.description: If applicable, the family associated with the provided head.

head.description: The family head used for the query.

Family.description: A group of mixnodes associated with particular staking entity. When defined all nodes belonging to the same family will be prioritised to be put onto the same layer.

label.description: Human readable label for this family.

proxy.description: Optional proxy (i.e. vesting contract address) used when creating the family.

FamilyHead.description: Head of particular family as identified by its identity key (i.e. public component of its ed25519 keypair stringified into base58).

get_gateway_bond.title: GatewayBondResponse
get_gateway_bond.description: Response containing details of a gateway with the provided identity key.

gateway.description: If there exists a gateway with the provided identity key, this field contains its details.

identity.description: The identity key (base58-encoded ed25519 public key) of the gateway.

Addr.description:
A human readable address.

In Cosmos, this is typically bech32 encoded. But for multi-chain smart contracts no assumptions should be made other than being UTF-8 encoded and of reasonable length.

This type represents a validated address. It can be created in the following ways 1. Use `Addr::unchecked(input)` 2. Use `let checked: Addr = deps.api.addr_validate(input)?` 3. Use `let checked: Addr = deps.api.addr_humanize(canonical_addr)?` 4. Deserialize from JSON. This must only be done from JSON that was validated before such as a contract's state. `Addr` must not be used in messages sent by the user because this would result in unvalidated instances.

This type is immutable. If you really need to mutate it (Really? Are you sure?), create a mutable copy using `let mut mutable = Addr::to_string()` and operate on that `String` instance.

Gateway.description: Information provided by the node operator during bonding that are used to allow other entities to use the services of this node.

clients_port.description: Port used by this gateway for listening for client requests.

host.description: Network address of this gateway, for example 1.1.1.1 or foo.gateway.com

identity_key.description: Base58 encoded ed25519 EdDSA public key of the gateway used to derive shared keys with clients

location.description: The physical, self-reported, location of this gateway.

mix_port.description: Port used by this gateway for listening for mix packets.

sphinx_key.description: Base58-encoded x25519 public key used for sphinx key derivation.

version.description: The self-reported semver version of this gateway.

GatewayBond.description: Basic gateway information provided by the node operator.

block_height.description: Block height at which this gateway has been bonded.

gateway.description: Information provided by the operator for the purposes of bonding.

owner.description: Address of the owner of this gateway.

pledge_amount.description: Original amount pledged by the operator of this node.

proxy.description: Entity who bonded this gateway on behalf of the owner. If exists, it's most likely the address of the vesting contract.

get_pending_mix_node_operator_reward.title: PendingRewardResponse
get_pending_mix_node_operator_reward.description: Response containing information about accrued rewards.

amount_earned.description: The amount of tokens that could be claimed.

amount_earned_detailed.description: The full pending rewards. Note that it's nearly identical to `amount_earned`, however, it contains few additional decimal points for more accurate reward calculation.

amount_staked.description: The amount of tokens initially staked.

mixnode_still_fully_bonded.description: The associated mixnode is still fully bonded, meaning it is neither unbonded nor in the process of unbonding that would have finished at the epoch transition.

Decimal.description:
A fixed-point decimal value with 18 fractional digits, i.e. Decimal(1_000_000_000_000_000_000) == 1.0

The greatest possible value that can be represented is 340282366920938463463.374607431768211455 (which is (2^128 - 1) / 10^18)

get_pending_operator_reward.title: PendingRewardResponse
get_pending_operator_reward.description: Response containing information about accrued rewards.

amount_earned.description: The amount of tokens that could be claimed.

amount_earned_detailed.description: The full pending rewards. Note that it's nearly identical to `amount_earned`, however, it contains few additional decimal points for more accurate reward calculation.

amount_staked.description: The amount of tokens initially staked.

mixnode_still_fully_bonded.description: The associated mixnode is still fully bonded, meaning it is neither unbonded nor in the process of unbonding that would have finished at the epoch transition.

Decimal.description:

get_rewarded_set.title: PagedRewardedSetResponse
get_rewarded_set.description: Response containing paged list of all mixnodes in the rewarded set.

nodes.description: Nodes in the current rewarded set.

start_next_after.description: Field indicating paging information for the following queries if the caller wishes to get further entries.

RewardedSetNodeStatus.description: Current state of given node in the rewarded set.

oneOf.description: Node that is currently active, i.e. is expected to be used by clients for mixing packets.
Node that is currently in standby, i.e. it's present in the rewarded set but is not active.

active_set_size.description: The expected number of mixnodes in the active set.

interval.description: Parameters that should remain unchanged throughout an interval.

rewarded_set_size.description: The expected number of mixnodes in the rewarded set (i.e. active + standby).

Decimal.description:
A fixed-point decimal value with 18 fractional digits, i.e. Decimal(1_000_000_000_000_000_000) == 1.0

The greatest possible value that can be represented is 340282366920938463463.374607431768211455 (which is (2^128 - 1) / 10^18)

IntervalRewardParams.description: Parameters required by the mix-mining reward distribution that do not change during an interval.

active_set_work_factor.description: Current active set work factor. It is not really expected to be changing very often. As a matter of fact, unless there's a very specific reason, it should remain constant.

epoch_reward_budget.description: Current value of the computed reward budget per epoch, per node. It is expected to be constant throughout the interval.

interval_pool_emission.description: Current maximum interval pool emission. Assuming all nodes in the rewarded set are fully saturated and have 100% performance, this % of the reward pool would get distributed in rewards to all operators and its delegators. It is not really expected to be changing very often. As a matter of fact, unless there's a very specific reason, it should remain constant.

reward_pool.description: Current value of the rewarding pool. It is expected to be constant throughout the interval.

stake_saturation_point.description: Current value of the stake saturation point. It is expected to be constant throughout the interval.

staking_supply.description: Current value of the staking supply. It is expected to be constant throughout the interval.

staking_supply_scale_factor.description: Defines the percentage of stake needed to reach saturation for all of the nodes in the rewarded set. Also known as `beta`.

sybil_resistance.description: Current value of the sybil resistance percent (`alpha`). It is not really expected to be changing very often. As a matter of fact, unless there's a very specific reason, it should remain constant.

Percent.description: Percent represents a value between 0 and 100% (i.e. between 0.0 and 1.0)

get_stake_saturation.title: StakeSaturationResponse
get_stake_saturation.description: Response containing the current state of the stake saturation of a mixnode with the provided id.

current_saturation.description: The current stake saturation of this node that is indirectly used in reward calculation formulas. Note that it can't be larger than 1.

mix_id.description: Id of the requested mixnode.

uncapped_saturation.description: The current, absolute, stake saturation of this node. Note that as the name suggests it can be larger than 1. However, anything beyond that value has no effect on the total node reward.

Decimal.description:
A fixed-point decimal value with 18 fractional digits, i.e. Decimal(1_000_000_000_000_000_000) == 1.0

The greatest possible value that can be represented is 340282366920938463463.374607431768211455 (which is (2^128 - 1) / 10^18)

get_state.title: ContractState
get_state.description: The current state of the mixnet contract.

owner.description: Address of the contract owner.

params.description: Contract parameters that could be adjusted in a transaction the contract admin.

rewarding_denom.description: The expected denom used for rewarding (and realistically any other operation). Default: `unym`

rewarding_validator_address.description: Address of "rewarding validator" (nym-api) that's allowed to send any rewarding-related transactions.

vesting_contract_address.description: Address of the vesting contract to which the mixnet contract would be sending all track-related messages.

interval_operating_cost.description: Defines the allowed interval operating cost range of operators. default: 0 - 1'000'000'000'000'000 (1 Billion native tokens - the total supply)

minimum_gateway_pledge.description: Minimum amount a gateway must pledge to get into the system.

minimum_mixnode_delegation.description: Minimum amount a delegator must stake in orders for his delegation to get accepted.

minimum_mixnode_pledge.description: Minimum amount a mixnode must pledge to get into the system.

profit_margin.description: Defines the allowed profit margin range of operators. default: 0% - 100%
